Metabolic syndrome increases your risk for heart disease, diabetes, and stroke.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">A blood test that measures your cholesterol also measures your triglycerides. For a general idea about your triglycerides level, compare your test results to the following:1</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Normal \u2014 Less than 150 milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL), or less than 1.7 millimoles per liter (mmol/L)</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Borderline high \u2014 150 to 199 mg/dL (1.8 to 2.2 mmol/L)</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">High \u2014 200 to 499 mg/dL (2.3 to 5.6 mmol/L)</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Very high \u2014 500 mg/dL or above (5.7 mmol/L or above)</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">High triglycerides are usually caused by other conditions, such as:--</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Obesity.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Poorly controlled diabetes.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">An underactive thyroid (hypothyroidism).</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Kidney disease.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Regularly eating more calories than you burn.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Drinking a lot of alcohol.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Certain medicines may also raise triglycerides. These medicines include:</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Tamoxifen.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Steroids.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Beta-blockers.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Diuretics.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Estrogen.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Birth control pills.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">High triglycerides usually don't cause symptoms.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">You can make diet and lifestyle changes to help lower your levels.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Lose weight and stay at a healthy weight.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Limit fats and sugars in your diet.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Be more active.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Quit smoking.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Limit alcohol.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">When you eat, your body converts any calories it doesn't need to use right away into triglycerides. The triglycerides are stored in your fat cells. Later, hormones release triglycerides for energy between meals. If you regularly eat more calories than you burn, particularly \"easy\" calories like carbohydrates and fats, you may have high triglycerides (hypertriglyceridemia).</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">You'll have to fast for nine to 12 hours before blood can be drawn for an accurate triglyceride measurement.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Triglycerides store unused calories and provide your body with energy, and cholesterol is used to build cells and certain hormones. Because triglycerides and cholesterol can't dissolve in blood, they circulate throughout your body with the help of proteins that transport the lipids (lipoproteins</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Sometimes high triglycerides are a sign of poorly controlled type 2 diabetes, low levels of thyroid hormones (hypothyroidism), liver or kidney disease, or rare genetic conditions that affect how your body converts fat to energy.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Lose weight. Cut back on calories. Avoid sugary and refined foods. Simple carbohydrates, such as sugar and foods made with white flour, can increase triglycerides.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Avoid the most concentrated sources of cholesterol, including meats high in saturated fat, egg yolks and whole milk products.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Eliminate trans fat</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">At levels above normal, the pancreatic beta cells that produce insulin are subjected to lipotoxicity, irreversible damage that can lead to inadequate insulin production by the pancreas over time.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">At very high levels above 1000 mg/dl, triglycerides cause pancreatitis, pancreatic inflammation that damages the delicate pancreatic tissues.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Whenever the liver has fatty acids delivered to it, it manufactures triglycerides (each triglyceride molecule contains 3\u2013tri\u2013fatty acids). Visceral fat\u2013deep abdominal fat in the abdomen\u2013is resistant to insulin and thereby provides a continual flow of fatty acids to the liver, a process that runs 24 hours a day.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">Cultivate healthy bowel flora\u2013\u201cFeeding\u201d bowel microorganisms the fibers they need allow them to convert fiber into butyrate, a fatty acid that yields metabolic effects that include reduction of insulin resistance, reduced blood sugar, reduced LDL values, and reduced triglycerides.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>Surya Namaskar brings down Triglycerides.</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">capt ajit vadakayil</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;\">..</span></div>\n</div>\n</span></li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_301B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 0px; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Also what makes vitamin\nD unique compared to other vitamins, is that when&nbsp; your body gets its vitamin D, it turns\nvitamin D into a hormone.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-VkVkkuEg2AQ/VbcTkQtKPwI/AAAAAAAA7kk/WTguRzNhYbk/s1600/nrc38691-f3.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"366\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-VkVkkuEg2AQ/VbcTkQtKPwI/AAAAAAAA7kk/WTguRzNhYbk/s640/nrc38691-f3.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This hormone is called \u201cactivated vitamin D\u201d or\n\u201ccalcitriol.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Eig3MLDIbWs/VbcTRVZTHwI/AAAAAAAA7kc/EEz50YHaEd0/s1600/imag7ges.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"229\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Eig3MLDIbWs/VbcTRVZTHwI/AAAAAAAA7kc/EEz50YHaEd0/s400/imag7ges.png\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Below: In olden days if they wanted you to die in prison, they would put you in a cell where NO daylight comes in.</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/wwUeIFGeDhE/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/wwUeIFGeDhE?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vitamin D is very\nimportant for strong bones. Calcium and phosphorus are essential for developing\nthe structure and strength of your bones, and you need vitamin D to absorb\nthese minerals. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Getting enough calcium\nand vitamin D is essential to building strong, dense bones when you're young\nand to keeping them strong and healthy as you age<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Calcium is a mineral\nthat is necessary for life. In addition to building bones and keeping them\nhealthy, calcium helps our blood clot, nerves send messages and muscles\ncontract . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">About 99 percent of the\ncalcium in our bodies is in our bones and teeth. Each day, we lose calcium\nthrough our skin, nails, hair, sweat, urine and feces, but our bodies cannot\nproduce new calcium.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That\u2019s why it\u2019s\nimportant to try to get calcium from the food we eat. When we don\u2019t get enough\ncalcium for our body\u2019s needs, it is taken from our bones. Yogurt and cheese are\nhigh in calcium. Certain green vegetables and other foods contain calcium in\nsmaller amounts .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, Vitamin D plays an\nimportant role in protecting your bones and your body requires it to absorb\ncalcium. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vitamin D receptors are\nfound in almost every human cell from your brain to your bones .</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Children need vitamin D\nto build strong bones, and adults need it to keep their bones strong and\nhealthy. If you don't get enough vitamin D, you may lose bone, have lower bone\ndensity, and you're more likely to break bones as you age. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Healthy sunlight\nvitamin has also proven to raise your brain power and may reduce aging as well.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-mOvRuFl88mo/VbceSbgs83I/AAAAAAAA7k8/4U5zsk88y9k/s1600/osteopyorosis-1024x1024.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-mOvRuFl88mo/VbceSbgs83I/AAAAAAAA7k8/4U5zsk88y9k/s640/osteopyorosis-1024x1024.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even if you eat foods\nthat contain a lot of calcium and phosphorus, without enough vitamin D, you\ncan\u2019t absorb them into your body.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-qLu9AA3VnXQ/VbceDHUaAFI/AAAAAAAA7k0/rGJRSkL3cSo/s1600/089fig01.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-qLu9AA3VnXQ/VbceDHUaAFI/AAAAAAAA7k0/rGJRSkL3cSo/s640/089fig01.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Severe vitamin D\ndeficiency can sometimes cause a condition called rickets in children and a condition\ncalled osteomalacia in adults.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Both of these conditions cause soft, thin, and\nbrittle bones.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-SspAGks1Sgk/Vbcfaz0ePaI/AAAAAAAA7lM/u9qXVDzCB-Y/s1600/Vit%2BD%2BMcap.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"394\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-SspAGks1Sgk/Vbcfaz0ePaI/AAAAAAAA7lM/u9qXVDzCB-Y/s640/Vit%2BD%2BMcap.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When your skin is\nexposed to the sun, it produces vitamin D and sends it to your liver. If you\ntake supplements or eat foods that contain vitamin D, your gut also sends the\nvitamin D to your liver. From here, your liver changes it to a substance called\n25(OH)D.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Aks_zWaenSk/VbcfJ7qtu7I/AAAAAAAA7lE/c3SgwK8PVJQ/s1600/downlojd.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"182\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Aks_zWaenSk/VbcfJ7qtu7I/AAAAAAAA7lE/c3SgwK8PVJQ/s400/downlojd.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When your doctor talks about your vitamin D levels, he means the\namount of 25(OH)D you have in your blood.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Lfc7NBkMUDE/Vbcf4pA-leI/AAAAAAAA7lU/DIroGNemGJs/s1600/F2.lar9ge.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"348\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Lfc7NBkMUDE/Vbcf4pA-leI/AAAAAAAA7lU/DIroGNemGJs/s640/F2.lar9ge.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The biologically active\nform of vitamin D is 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D (1,25(OH)2 D). Measuring serum\nlevels of 1,25(OH)2 D should be considered upon suspicion of deficiency or\nexcess of 1,25(OH)2 D. &nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plasma\n1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D (1,25(OH)2 D) is tightly controlled by plasma\nparathyroid hormone (PTH), serum calcium and serum phosphate</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-4LJ4Eo9fXjo/VbcgSZWbZoI/AAAAAAAA7lc/yJa3SU3h6cM/s1600/ima36ges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-4LJ4Eo9fXjo/VbcgSZWbZoI/AAAAAAAA7lc/yJa3SU3h6cM/s1600/ima36ges.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Decreased levels of\n1,25(OH)2 D can result from chronic kidney disease, and severe vitamin D\ndeficiency. The decrease of 1,25(OH)2 D level is more prominent when kidney\nfailure progresses. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The active form of\nvitamin D, 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D3 [1,25(OH)2D3], has been shown to inhibit\nthe development of autoimmune diseases, including inflammatory bowel disease\n(IBD) and several asshole disease Chrons.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/5Q7DdWBlHsc/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/5Q7DdWBlHsc?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vitamin D receptors are\npresent in most if not all cells in the body. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vitamin D has\nphysiologic effects much broader than a role in mineral homeostasis and bone\nfunction.&nbsp;&nbsp; Ample amount of sunlight can\nprevent vitamin D and B1 deficiency that may cause diseases such as rickets and\nberiberi.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vitamin D is\nfat-soluble--meaning some dietary fat is necessary for its absorption like\nvirgin coconut oil .&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: xx-large;\">EVIL PHARMA IS GONNA GET VERY UPSET WITH CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL FOR PUTTING UP THIS POST.</b><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Below : &nbsp;Before pancreatic\ncancer patients would surely die -- because the pancreas had dense and inflamed\ntissues, which is closed and resistant to radiation and chemotherapy. <span style=\"color: red;\">Vitamin D does the trick.</span></b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/RmV3i7kP_1c/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/RmV3i7kP_1c?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Suryanamaskar PREVENTS\nonset of Diabetes type 2 as sunlight controls blood sugar level.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sunlight triggers the\nsynthesis of vitamin D, causing immune cells to travel to the outer layer of\nthe skin where they are able to protect and help repair damaged skin. Getting\nenough calcium and vitamin D is essential to building strong, dense bones when\nyou're young and to keeping them strong and healthy as you age<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yes, toxic humpless cow's\nmilk gives Calcium--but so does most of the other food you eat like brocolli,\ncabbage, nuts , sesame seeds, sea weeds, carrot etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">The ideal calcium to\nmagnesium ratio for the human body should be 1:1.&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Too much calcium, depletes\nmagnesium levels.</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">Humpless cow A1 milk's Calcium/ Magnesium ratio is 10:1.</span> &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Every 1 part of\ncalcium will use up 1 part of magnesium, in order to be assimilated.&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<br />\n&nbsp;<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The remaining magnesium, not used\nup by the calcium, will be available to serve other functions in the body.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; And only five are put back in when refined flours are\n\u201cenriched\u201d. &nbsp;Magnesium is not one of\nthem.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The typical American\nconvenience food diet of fast food, pizzas, pastries, cookies and fried foods\nconsists almost exclusively of refined grains, oils and sugars. Over time,\nexcess consumption of these foods can lead to both obesity and magnesium\ndeficiency, a potentially fatal combination.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Modern fertilizers are\na convenient substitute for centuries old crop rotation practices which\nprevented farmland from becoming depleted through repetitive use. Yet they do\nlittle to improve the vitamin and mineral content of crops, and invariably\nworsens it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Minerals are more\nsusceptible to the reductions in soil quality than vitamins. Whereas many\nvitamins can actually be produced by growing plants themselves, if minerals are\nnot first present in the soil they will not be present in the produce grown\nthere.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Potash, a commonly-used\npotassium fertilizer easily taken up by plants, severely &nbsp;reduces the amount of magnesium absorbed by\nthe plant. &nbsp;&nbsp;Modern nitrogen-based\nfertilizers have a tendency to make crops bulkier, yet nutrient poor.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THESE ARTIFICIAL\nFERTILISERS HAVE SPOILT OUR UNDERGROUND WATER AQUIFERS .&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IN\nANCIENT DAYS WE CREMATED DEAD HUMANS AND ANIMALS. While the\nfruits these plants produce may be big, they suffer in nutritional quality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The effect is one which\nis beneficial to the producer, but not the consumer. Consumers pay more for\nheavier, water-laden produce that contains less vitamins and minerals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Please suggest me the natural or ayurvedic way of curing the psoriasis.</div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_322BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.3999996185303px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"bc_0_326T\" kind=\"t\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\" t=\"0\" u=\"0\">\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_326TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\" unselectable=\"on\"><div style=\"zoom: 1;\" unselectable=\"on\">\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_326B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_322b+seedFFD\" kind=\"d\"><img src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-DUOJiRC5obw/UwiDtflONuI/AAAAAAAAppU/hpxnNJK2CIw/s1600/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_322b+seedFFD\" kind=\"d\">\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3694963278129597288\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_326M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Part of the reaction occurs when a type of white blood cell called a T cell mistakenly attacks healthy skin cells.<br />\n<br />\nThese overactive T cells then trigger other immune responses that collectively speed up the growth cycle of skin cells, causing them to move to the outermost layer of your skin in a matter of days rather than weeks.<br />\n<br />\nBecause the dead skin cannot be removed quickly enough, it builds up into the thick patches characteristic of psoriasis<br />\n<br />\nThis disease causes low self esteem -- as many people thing that it is contagious-it is NOT .<br />\n<br />\nVitamin D is a potent immune modulator, making it very important for the prevention of autoimmune diseases.<br />\n<br />\nVitamin D is known to reduce adaptive immunity (T Cells) therefore reduce the overproduction of skin cells.<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</span></li>\n<span id=\"bc_0_322b+seedFFD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_322b+seedFFD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_322b+seedFFD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_322b+seedFFD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-latin;\">Sunlight triggers the synthesis of vitamin D,\ncausing immune cells to travel to the outer layer of the skin where they are\nable to protect and help repair damaged skin. &nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vitamin D is actually\nable to enter cancer cells and trigger apoptosis (cell death).</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Alb3qEph2Ec/VbdP16XK3TI/AAAAAAAA7l8/6HWQVTc4NTc/s1600/vitamin-d-and-c9K4ardiology-44-728.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Alb3qEph2Ec/VbdP16XK3TI/AAAAAAAA7l8/6HWQVTc4NTc/s640/vitamin-d-and-c9K4ardiology-44-728.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##########################################</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Despite its name,\nvitamin D is not a regular vitamin. It's actually a steroid hormone that you\nare designed to obtain primarily through sun exposure, not via your diet.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vitamin D is a\nfat-soluble vitamin, which means if you have a gastrointestinal condition that\naffects your ability to absorb fat, you may have lower absorption of\nfat-soluble vitamins like vitamin D as well. &nbsp;This includes gut conditions like celiac and non-celiac gluten sensitivity.</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/vC4d_qlFbrc/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/vC4d_qlFbrc?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Remember , UVB\nradiation does not penetrate glass, so exposure to sunshine indoors through a\nwindow does not produce vitamin D.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vitamin D overdose is\nimpossible from UV exposure; the skin reaches an equilibrium where the vitamin\ndegrades as fast as it is created. Individuals with limited sun exposure in\ncold and dark countries need to include good sources of vitamin D in their diet\nor take a supplement.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-tVzgU8sZvvo/VbeNIP7v4lI/AAAAAAAA7mg/S0LFcstMROY/s1600/image34As.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"353\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-tVzgU8sZvvo/VbeNIP7v4lI/AAAAAAAA7mg/S0LFcstMROY/s400/image34As.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">If your body has ample\nvitamin D levels, it helps reduce bad cholesterol and increases good\ncholesterol. It also helps in the essential repair and maintenance activities\nof the body.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-kscdTMApP54/VbeRN3PpViI/AAAAAAAA7ms/pzRy6sQx0nE/s1600/110531_melatotninrhythm.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"226\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-kscdTMApP54/VbeRN3PpViI/AAAAAAAA7ms/pzRy6sQx0nE/s400/110531_melatotninrhythm.png\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Melatonin is a hormone\nsecreted in by your pineal gland &nbsp;at\nnight in darkness. Melatonin\u2019s immediate precursor is the neurotransmitter\nserotonin, which is a major player in uplifting your mood.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like serotonin,\nmelatonin plays important roles in your physical and mental health. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Insufficient melatonin\nproduction can set you up for:--</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Decreased REM sleep.</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Decreased immune\nfunction<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Accelerated cancer cell\nproliferation and tumor growth (including leukemia)<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Blood pressure\ninstability<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Decreased free radical\nscavenging<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Increased plaques in\nthe brain, like those seen with Alzheimer\u2019s disease<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Increased risk of\nosteoporosis<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Diabetic\nmicroangiopathy (capillary damage)<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Not getting enough\nsleep may even accelerate aging and shorten your lifespan.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Obesity</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-78xhKMvAT5U/VbeRcYY5RAI/AAAAAAAA7m0/KQGg7tczlnA/s1600/melatonin-benefit912s.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"396\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-78xhKMvAT5U/VbeRcYY5RAI/AAAAAAAA7m0/KQGg7tczlnA/s400/melatonin-benefit912s.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Low melatonin levels to\ndepression in a variety of populations, including multiple sclerosis patients\nand post-menopausal women. Clearly, anything that negatively effects melatonin\nproduction is likely to have a detrimental effect on your mood.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Having a light on at\nnight squelches the production of melatonin. &nbsp; In addition to dampening your\nmood, a confused body clock can result in increased appetite and unwanted\nweight gain which makes you look like a HALWAI&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/v-SCVHlHNn4/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/v-SCVHlHNn4?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sleeping in a\npitch-black bedroom is an important and relatively easy lifestyle choice to\nmake for your health. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Even the dim\nglow from your clock radio could be interfering with your ability to sleep --\nand more importantly, your long term health and risk of developing cancer or\nmajor depression.</span> <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-h2GA6sq-WUQ/VbeUy39O-sI/AAAAAAAA7nA/zefAQXz4XX0/s1600/melatonin9_chart.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"380\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-h2GA6sq-WUQ/VbeUy39O-sI/AAAAAAAA7nA/zefAQXz4XX0/s640/melatonin9_chart.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Working nights has been\nlinked to significantly lower levels of serotonin, which has negative effects\non your mood. </span>&nbsp;<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Changes\nin light exposure can alter levels of the hormones melatonin and serotonin,\nwhich help regulate mood and sleep.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-YKS_cEVmT38/VbeVN_y353I/AAAAAAAA7nI/ar0QNVdpYwI/s1600/asphalia-presen98tation-new-12-728.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-YKS_cEVmT38/VbeVN_y353I/AAAAAAAA7nI/ar0QNVdpYwI/s640/asphalia-presen98tation-new-12-728.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Increase in sleep hormone melatonin,</span>&nbsp;<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">prevents the loss of serotonin and\ndopamine \u2013 two hormones responsible for human happiness..</span>\n<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Melatonin suppression\nhas far worse consequences than simply poor sleep outcomes: it has also been\nshown to increase the risk of cancer, impair immune system function, and\npossibly lead to cardiometabolic consequences such as type 2 diabetes,\nmetabolic syndrome, obesity, and heart disease.</span><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nM<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">elatonin suppression is\nintensity dependent.&nbsp; Lower intensities\ncan have similar suppression effects at longer durations; for example, two\nhours at 500 lux would have a similar effect as one hour at 1000 lux.</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When\nsunlight hits our eyes, a message is sent to the pineal gland in the brain and\nproduction of melatonin ( hormone that makes us drowsy ) is\nshut down until the sun goes down again.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your body gets a clear signal that\nit\u2019s no longer night and this helps to maintain a normal circadian rhythm. When\nit gets dark outside, your body gets the signal again and you feel tired and\ndrowsy at bedtime.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Known as the body\u2019s most efficient free-radical scavenger\nwith an impressive ability to control oxidative damage, melatonin has powerful\nantioxidant, anti-inflammatory and immune properties.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These properties function\nas brain, heart, neurological, cognitive and cancer protection through the\nreduction of trauma from brain injury; preventing heart muscle damage;\nneuroprotection; increasing cognitive functioning; and offering cancer support\nand reducing the toxic effects of chemotherapy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-FfB7GnZs2Ss/VbeVnNnZDrI/AAAAAAAA7nQ/H0NwlkeOx_M/s1600/kayumov-et-al-2005-li93ht-and-melatonin.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"372\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-FfB7GnZs2Ss/VbeVnNnZDrI/AAAAAAAA7nQ/H0NwlkeOx_M/s640/kayumov-et-al-2005-li93ht-and-melatonin.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Human growth hormone (\nHGH ) is an important part of the body\u2019s endocrine system.&nbsp; HGH is released by the brain into the\nbloodstream during sleep, and its release is part of the repair and restoration\nfunction of sleep.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The pituitary gland\nreleases growth hormone non-continuously \u2013 the release looks like a pulse.&nbsp; Sleep and exercise induce the release of the\nhormone.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sleep helps us thrive\nby contributing to a healthy immune system, and can also balance our appetites\nby helping to regulate levels of the hormones ghrelin and leptin, which play a\nrole in our feelings of hunger and fullness. So when we\u2019re sleep deprived, we\nmay feel the need to eat more, which can lead to weight gain and that HALWAI look.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Melatonin is at the\nforefront of cancer immunotherapy: providing immune boost properties, working\nwith anti-tumor systems, improving tumour killing power , decreasing adverse\nside effects of chemotherapy and radiation including low platelet count,\nneurotoxicity, cardiotoxicity and mouth sores .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Melatonin is an\nanti-oxidant 10 times better than vitamin E.&nbsp;\nMelatonin is decreased in schizophrenia, particularly in chronic\npatients. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Suryanamaskar &nbsp;tells our body to prepare for our daily routine.\nDuring this time our body releases cortisol and adrenalin to get our bodies\ngoing and serotonin to help our brain wake up.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As the sun rises and\ngets stronger these levels of adrenalin and serotonin increase along with our\ncore temperature and metabolism making us hungry. By mid-afternoon our\nmetabolism is peaking. This is a prime time for physical activity as we can\nconvert fat into energy more efficiently now than at any other time during the\nday.</span> <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The disruption in\nmelatonin levels may be why shift working is linked to a wide array of health\nissues including cancer.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>&nbsp;<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Melatonin is a powerful hormone,\nnot a sleeping pill. When we take a hormone into our body, it has the ability\nto not only disrupt our regulation of that specific hormone, but many other\nhormones.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-xlsesu9k20U/VbeZzx8OSSI/AAAAAAAA7nc/tN-cWKOodoc/s1600/i47mages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"232\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-xlsesu9k20U/VbeZzx8OSSI/AAAAAAAA7nc/tN-cWKOodoc/s400/i47mages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Melatonin supplements should\nabsolutely not be dolled out like candy , for sleep problems - like what modern doctors do.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-RF0hfmqBj9k/Vbeap9KTI2I/AAAAAAAA7nk/0id3e9W4B3Y/s1600/1397065975_c195edff692.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-RF0hfmqBj9k/Vbeap9KTI2I/AAAAAAAA7nk/0id3e9W4B3Y/s640/1397065975_c195edff692.jpg\" width=\"620\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">When I work late at night on my computer , I wear my amber Rayban shades \u2013 I call it &nbsp;\u201cmelatonin glasses\u201d at least an hour before bed. Even brief exposure to blue LED light in the middle of the night can disrupt your melatonin balance.</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-9vrSGJG4m6k/VbfGIp8GPmI/AAAAAAAA7n0/Z610tLQEG8o/s1600/image3B.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-9vrSGJG4m6k/VbfGIp8GPmI/AAAAAAAA7n0/Z610tLQEG8o/s400/image3B.png\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">Sunlight contains ultraviolet (UV) rays that come in three different lengths: UV-A, UV-B, and UV-C.</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Ultraviolet A or (UVA) </span>spans 315 to 400 nm. UV-A is responsible for sunburns in humans. This band &nbsp;is used in cosmetic artificial sun tanning (tanning booths and tanning beds) and PUVA therapy for psoriasis. &nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">UVA rays are longer in wavelength than UVB. &nbsp;Longer wavelengths are reflected slightly more than shorter wavelengths. UV-A has less energy than UV-B, and is not absorbed by ozone in the atmosphere. However, it can be blocked from the surface by cloud cover . &nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">While it is absorbed less readily by water, it can penetrate deeper than UV-B or UV-C. &nbsp;Most glass used for windows blocks UVB but not UVA.</span></span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">&nbsp;Ultraviolet B or (UVB) </span>range spans 280 to 315 nm. &nbsp;UV-B rays are the ones that are capable of producing vitamin D in your body by acting on cholesterol found in your skin. &nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">When buying sunglasses make sure you get a pair that says it blocks 100 percent of UVA and UVB rays, or says UV 400 (which means it blocks all UVA and UVB rays). While glass does block most UVB rays, UVA rays still penetrate through glass. &nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">When your skin is exposed to UVB radiation from the sun, &nbsp;it begins to produce vitamin D3 - which is converted by the liver and kidneys to &nbsp;CALCITRIOL (Active form of vitamin D) needed for organ and cell functions. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">UVB radiation penetrates\nuncovered skin and converts cutaneous 7-dehydrocholesterol to previtamin D3, which\nin turn becomes vitamin D3.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">Exposure to morning sunlight also helps raise body temperature to normal (after a slight reduction during sleep), and numerous brain activities including increased alertness and better cognition\u2014helping mood and vitality.</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">UV-B will reach greater depths in saline water than in freshwater and can reach as deep as 20m below the surface of the ocean&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Ultraviolet C or (UVC) </span>range, which spans a range of 100 to 280 nm. The term ultraviolet refers to the fact that the radiation is at higher frequency than violet light (and, hence, also invisible to the human eye). Due to absorption by the Ozone layer of the atmosphere very little reaches Earth's surface.&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">This spectrum of radiation has germicidal properties, and is used in germicidal lamps.UVC is the highest-energy, most-dangerous type of ultraviolet radiation, and causes adverse effects that can variously be mutagenic or carcinogenic.</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">Surya Namaskar is designed to do sun gazing at low altitude so that &nbsp;our eyes to get vitamin A during the 1 hour safe period window. &nbsp;Vitamin A is necessary for the health of the eye, the only vitamin that the eye requires. If you sun gaze, the spectacles and the associated power in the eye will go away and this will provide better eyesight without glasses.</span></span><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Radio waves have\nwavelengths that range from several millimeters to hundreds of kilometers. Knowing\nthis &nbsp;is important because it means that\nfor an object to stop the waves, it needs to be as large or larger than the\nwavelength. When a body is warmer than its environment, it emits infrared\nradiation. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The is also true for\nthe warmed up surface of the Earth: The surface of the Earth emits infrared\nradiation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because infrared\nradiation has a different wavelength than solar radiation, its transmission\nbehaviour through the atmosphere is different: 25% will be transmitted and 75%\nwill be reflected back to the Earth. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This leads to a further\nincrease of temperature on Earth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sun emits\nradiation\u2014in the form of electromagnetic rays\u2014which reaches you here on earth.\nWhile the visible part of this spectrum lights up your world, other parts of\nthe spectrum including ultraviolet B (UVB) and ultraviolet A (UVA) have varying\neffects.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
