, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OUR ZIONIST DARLING AND\nAPCO BRANDED PM MODI IS PROMOTING GM FOODS IN INDIA . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I WISH ROTHSCHILD GIVES\nMODI A NOBELPEACE PRIZE SOON..&nbsp; HE WILL\nHAVE NOWHERE TO HIDE IN INDIA AFTER THAT. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE FAMILIES OF &nbsp;65 PARSIS WHO WERE KNIGHTED BY ROTHSCHILD BEFORE\nINDEPENDENCE ARE ALL HIDING TODAY.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/05/monsanto-and-farmer-suicides-in-india.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/05/monsanto-and-farmer-suicides-in-india.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-FMuRFXQRQws/VW-2vN__4cI/AAAAAAAA6nI/8MjNYNsOXlQ/s1600/imagegs.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"226\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-FMuRFXQRQws/VW-2vN__4cI/AAAAAAAA6nI/8MjNYNsOXlQ/s400/imagegs.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The name of toxic canola\noil was originally LEAR (Low Erucic Acid Rapeseed) but for marketing purposes\nwas changed to canola oil- TO AVOID THE SEXUAL SLUR.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Canola oil is produced\nfrom the rapeseed plant, which is a part of the mustard family.&nbsp; &nbsp;It\nworks well as an industrial oil, not a food, and has been used in candles,\nsoaps, lipsticks, lubricants, inks, biofuels and even insecticides.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once the powers that be\nfigured out how to genetically modify rapeseed oil, it began being sold as an\nedible product.&nbsp;&nbsp; It was brought to\nmarket by the Zionist monopolised media , with the claim that it\u2019s a wonder\noil, low in saturated fats and has omega-3 fatty acids. But in its hybridized\nand modified state, it can cause a large number of health issues.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">92% of Canola oil is GM\nand it is a pertly hydrogenated oil. A monounsaturated oil, rapeseed oil has\nhigh levels of erucic acid. Erucic acid is a fatty acid that is associated with\nheart damage. &nbsp;This oil brims with free\nradicals.&nbsp; The Zionist never use Canola\noil in baby formulas \u2013if it is so healthy , why not ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Synthetic trans fats\nare known to promote inflammation, which is a hallmark of most chronic and/or\nserious diseases. Most also contain high amounts of omega-6 fats in the form of\nprocessed vegetable oils. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These polyunsaturated fats (PUFAs) tend to stimulate\ninflammatory processes in your body, and they are very chemically unstable and\nprone to oxidation. Consuming these oxidized fats in excess has been linked to\nall sorts of health problems, such as atherosclerosis and heart disease.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Three-quarters of the\nsodium in our diets isn\u2019t from the saltshaker or salt put by us.&nbsp; It\u2019s hidden in processed foods, such as\ncanned vegetables and soups, condiments like soy sauce and Worcestershire\nsauce, fast-food burgers (and fries, of course), and cured or preserved meats\nlike bacon, ham, and deli turkey.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sodium is necessary for\nlife. It helps regulate blood pressure, maintains the body\u2019s fluid balance,\ntransmits nerve impulses, makes muscles \u2014 including your heart \u2014 contract, and\nkeeps your senses of taste, smell, and touch working properly. You need a\nlittle every day to replace what\u2019s lost to sweat, tears, and other excretions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you consume more\nsalt than your body needs, your body retains fluid simply to dilute the extra\nsodium in your bloodstream. This raises blood volume, forcing your heart to\nwork harder; at the same time, it makes veins and arteries constrict. The combination\nraises blood pressure.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Refined carbohydrates\nlike breakfast cereals, bagels, waffles, pretzels, and most other processed\nfoods quickly break down to sugar in your body. This increases your insulin and\nleptin levels, and contributes to insulin resistance, which is the primary\nunderlying factor of nearly every chronic disease and condition known to man,\nincluding weight gain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Processed foods are designed\nto make you overeat. Your body is designed to naturally regulate how much you\neat and the energy you burn. But food manufacturers have figured out how to\nover-ride these intrinsic regulators, designing processed foods that are\nengineered to by \"hyper-rewarding.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Processed foods\nstimulate such a strong reward response in our brains that it becomes very easy\nto overeat.&nbsp;&nbsp; One of the guiding\nprinciples for the processed food industry is known as \"sensory-specific\nsatiety.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The greatest successes,\nwhether beverages or foods, owe their \"craveability\" to complex\nformulas that pique your taste buds just enough, without overwhelming them,\nthereby overriding your brain's inclination to say \"enough.\" &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Potato chips are among the most addictive\njunk foods on the market, containing all three bliss-inducing ingredients:\nsugar (from the potato), salt, and fat. Unlike whole foods, which contain a mix\nof carbohydrates, fats, proteins, fiber, and water to help you feel satisfied,\nprocessed foods stimulate dopamine, a feel-good neurotransmitter, making you\nfeel good even though the food lacks nutrients and fiber.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This artificial\ndopamine stimulation can lead to excessive food cravings and, ultimately, food\naddiction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Acrylamide increases\nthe risk of several types of cancer.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nPotato chips in particular are notoriously high in this dangerous\nchemical.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By cutting out these\nhigh-glycemic processed foods you can retrain your body to burn fat instead of\nsugar, a key component of health and weight loss. However, it's important to\nreplace these foods with healthy fats, not protein\u2014a fact that's often not\naddressed<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-canUZhBME6w/VW_FkAsDCEI/AAAAAAAA6nw/r7O4oURHDf0/s1600/article-1055g471-02A287B700000578-989_468x203.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"276\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-canUZhBME6w/VW_FkAsDCEI/AAAAAAAA6nw/r7O4oURHDf0/s640/article-1055g471-02A287B700000578-989_468x203.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Butylated\nhydroxyanisole (BHA) and butylated hydrozyttoluene (BHT) are preservatives that\naffect the neurological system of your brain, alter behavior, and have the\npotential to cause cancer. Tertiary butylhydroquinone (TBHQ) is a chemical\npreservative so deadly that just five grams can kill you.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Below: &nbsp; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Processing modifies or removes important components of\nfood, like fiber, water, and nutrients, changing the way they are digested and\nassimilated in your body.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><b>Below:Lead is a endocrine disruptor</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Below: Virgin coconut oils gets rancid very fast.</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Rynr7wm8kuI/VW_H_U28gGI/AAAAAAAA6oM/tp8MYjzdQmc/s1600/food_spoilage_raete.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"377\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Rynr7wm8kuI/VW_H_U28gGI/AAAAAAAA6oM/tp8MYjzdQmc/s400/food_spoilage_raete.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This phenomenon is also called the 'blood sugar roller coaster' \u2013 which many\npeople who have been on a high-carb diet can relate to. Not surprisingly,\neating a lot of refined carbohydrates is associated with negative health\neffects and many chronic diseases.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-jPEMjSEg820/VW_I_nJ-JbI/AAAAAAAA6og/PCoDRsNz99Q/s1600/igmages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-jPEMjSEg820/VW_I_nJ-JbI/AAAAAAAA6og/PCoDRsNz99Q/s1600/igmages.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Do NOT be fooled by\nlabels like 'whole grains' that are often plastered on processed food packages,\nincluding breakfast cereals. These are usually whole grains that have been\npulverized into very fine flour and are just as harmful as their refined\ncounterparts.\"<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-_eGOUkEIWSw/VW_N70zK7II/AAAAAAAA6pM/aIc-34dCJ4I/s1600/healthy-parentinBg-bpa-toxic-receipt-paper-mommy-greenest-photo.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-_eGOUkEIWSw/VW_N70zK7II/AAAAAAAA6pM/aIc-34dCJ4I/s400/healthy-parentinBg-bpa-toxic-receipt-paper-mommy-greenest-photo.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">DIGRESSION:-</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Being a Chemical tanker\nship captain I am familiar with toxic chemical bioaccumulation.&nbsp; I am more qualified and trained to comment on\nsuch matters than people in the food industry. &nbsp;I worked in a dangerous toxic bioaccumulative environment\n( yes- more dangerous than the soldiers tracking naxals ) .<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b><br /></b></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>It was pathetic to\nwatch retired Indian Generals and Admirals coming on TV and telling us how many\ndangers they faced \u2013 to push for ONE RANK ONE PENSION.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Bioaccumulation means\nan increase in the concentration of a chemical in the human body over time Toxic\ncompounds accumulate in the human body when they are stored up faster than they\nare metabolized or excreted.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Uptake describes the\nentrance of a chemical into the human body-- such as by breathing, swallowing,\nor absorbing it through the skin -- without regard to its subsequent storage,\nmetabolism, and excretion. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Storage, means the\ntemporary deposit of a chemical in body tissue or in an organ. Storage is just\none facet of chemical bioaccumulation. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Bioaccumulation begins\nwhen a chemical passes from the environment into a human cells.&nbsp; Some chemicals are attracted to certain\nsites, and by binding to proteins or dissolving in fats, they are temporarily\nstored. If uptake slows or is not continued, or if the chemical is not very\ntightly bound in the cell, the body can eventually eliminate the chemical. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Some chemicals bind to\nspecific sites in the body, prolonging their stay, whereas others move freely\nin and out. The time between uptake and eventual elimination of a chemical\ndirectly affects bioaccumulation. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Chemicals that are\nimmediately eliminated, for example, do not bioaccumulate. Large, fat individuals&nbsp; with low rates of metabolism will\nbioaccumulate more than the small, thin variety.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Persistent,\nbioaccumulative, toxic chemicals are called PBT.&nbsp; A chemical\u2019s tendency to persist, and to\nbioaccumulate is often used as a measure of exposure.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Chemicals can\naccumulate that enter the body through respiration, skin contact, or other\nmeans. As a general rule the less water soluble a substance is, the more likely\nit is to bioaccumulate. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Persistence is the\nability of a chemical to remain in the environment in an unchanged form.&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Chemicals with greater persistence pose greater possibilities for exposure\nbecause they can continue to cycle through the environment. A chemical\u2019s\npersistence can be directly measured. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Chemicals can also\ndegrade to PBT\u2019s. The degradation byproducts of most chemicals are simply not\nknown, although they can have equal or greater hazardous properties compared\nwith the parent chemical.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Toxicity determinations\ninclude acute and chronic impacts. Toxicological endpoints include: carcinogen,\nmutagen/genotoxin, teratogen, endocrine disruptor, neurotoxicant, reproductive\nsystem toxicant, liver toxicant, cardiovascular or blood toxicant, irritant,\nand many others.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">In Europe, the REACH\ninitiative has prioritized carcinogens, mutagens, reproductive toxins, and\nendocrine disrupters and&nbsp; PBT\u2019s.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Below: A LIFTED quote from 6000 year old Ayurveda</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-HUyBmdr1sC0/VW_NhO7ZoKI/AAAAAAAA6pE/B2VTu4M4WBE/s1600/imagHes.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-HUyBmdr1sC0/VW_NhO7ZoKI/AAAAAAAA6pE/B2VTu4M4WBE/s320/imagHes.jpg\" width=\"307\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Toxic chemicals can\ncause a change in hormone composition or cause a disruption of the endocrine\nsystem. The endocrine system is composed of glands that secrete chemicals\ncalled hormones into the bloodstream for the control of body functions. These\ncontaminants can imitate endocrine hormones or inhibit the action of endocrine\nhormones. They are called endocrine disruptors.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Many halogenated\nhydrocarbons have moderate to high toxicity by inhalation. The brominated\nmaterials tend to be particularly toxic. Much of the toxicity is due to the\nfact that these substances are not metabolized, but persist and accumulate in\nfatty tissues (they tend to be fat-soluble).<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-045nx5jHJjA/VW_NI5vPN0I/AAAAAAAA6o8/E2tAJRH4SUw/s1600/imJages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-045nx5jHJjA/VW_NI5vPN0I/AAAAAAAA6o8/E2tAJRH4SUw/s400/imJages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Health Hazard \u2013\nChemicals that may cause various acute or chronic adverse health effects such\nas corrosives, carcinogens, irritants, mutagens, teratogens and sensitizers.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-TKwc3TZABTU/VW_OK7b-oWI/AAAAAAAA6pU/E5HRHnaM168/s1600/endocVrine-disruptor-47-728.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-TKwc3TZABTU/VW_OK7b-oWI/AAAAAAAA6pU/E5HRHnaM168/s400/endocVrine-disruptor-47-728.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Mutagen is an agent that\nchanges the DNA.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Teratogenesis literally\nmeaning monster-making, which derives from teratology, the study of the\nfrequency, causation, and development of congenital malformations\u2014misleadingly\ncalled birth defects. These include gross morphological abnormalities, such as\ncleft lip. May also include phenomena such as increased risk of cervical cancer\nor discoloration of tooth enamel.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-JqDu-R0TrbE/VW_Ma8aKCyI/AAAAAAAA6os/_U47GE4YJso/s1600/FF.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-JqDu-R0TrbE/VW_Ma8aKCyI/AAAAAAAA6os/_U47GE4YJso/s400/FF.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">GIRLS IN WESTERN COUNTRIES GET FIRST PERIODS ( MENSES ) AT A VERY YOUNG AGE DUE TO ENDOCRINE DISRUPTING TOXIC CHEMICALS IN PROCESSED FOODS.&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-5euqAV64t64/VW_RQB_wufI/AAAAAAAA6pw/VD3J0XEywbE/s1600/endBocrine2.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-5euqAV64t64/VW_RQB_wufI/AAAAAAAA6pw/VD3J0XEywbE/s1600/endBocrine2.gif\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">IN INDIA LEAD IN NOODLES HAS DONE THE TRICK. &nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">THESE GIRLS WILL BE INFERTILE WHEN THEY WANT TO HAVE A BABY.</b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-B5gD4ROTPaE/VW_QlJFhqDI/AAAAAAAA6po/yrKLdGgrRo4/s1600/imGHages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-B5gD4ROTPaE/VW_QlJFhqDI/AAAAAAAA6po/yrKLdGgrRo4/s320/imGHages.jpg\" width=\"229\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your internal organs\nprocess whole foods much more efficiently than processed \u201cjunk\u201d foods.&nbsp;&nbsp; Processed foods overstimulate the production\nof dopamine, AKA the \u201cpleasure\u201d neurotransmitter, which leads to excessive\ncravings.&nbsp;&nbsp; Your mind becomes unable to\nresist the refined salt and sugar, so you continue eating \u201cjunk\u201d foods in mass\namounts, which leads to obesity and other health problems such as diabetes and\ncancer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Below: Your gallbladder is a\nsmall, pear-shaped organ on the right side of your abdomen, just beneath your\nliver.&nbsp;</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-bmGKFhxnsRk/VW_agaDI1JI/AAAAAAAA6qU/ZOQfC6motRY/s1600/understanding_gallstsones_basics_gallstones.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-bmGKFhxnsRk/VW_agaDI1JI/AAAAAAAA6qU/ZOQfC6motRY/s640/understanding_gallstsones_basics_gallstones.jpg\" width=\"496\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The gallbladder is a\nsmall pouch that sits just under the liver. The gallbladder stores bile\nproduced by the liver. After meals, the gallbladder is empty and flat, like a\ndeflated balloon. Before a meal, the gallbladder may be full of bile and about\nthe size of a small pear.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In response to signals,\nthe gallbladder squeezes stored bile into the small intestine through a series\nof tubes called ducts. &nbsp;Bile helps digest\nfats, but the gallbladder itself is not essential. Removing the gallbladder in\nan otherwise healthy individual typically causes no observable problems with\nhealth or digestion yet there may be a small risk of diarrhea and fat\nmalabsorption. Remember god has NOT given you any useless spare body part.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You do not need a\ngallbladder to digest food in theory. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Bile\nstill flows from the liver to the gut once the gallbladder is removed. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, in practice there\nis no longer any storage area for bile between meals. &nbsp;The flow of bile is therefore constant,\nwithout the surges of bile that occur from a gallbladder when you eat a meal. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bile helps to digest\nfood, particularly fatty foods. &nbsp;Gallstones\noccur when bile, which is normally fluid, forms stones. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gallstones commonly\ncontain lumps of cholesterol-like (fatty) material that has solidified and\nhardened. Sometimes bile pigments or calcium deposits form gallstones. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A GASTROENTEROLOGIST is\nan internist who has completed specialty training in the treatment of digestive\ndisorders. &nbsp;Digestive disorders include\ndisorders of the esophagus, stomach, small and large intestines, pancreas,\ngallbladder, and liver.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gallstones form in the\ngallbladder, a small organ located under the liver. &nbsp;&nbsp;The gallbladder aids in the digestive process\nby storing bile and secreting it into the small intestine when food enters. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bile is a fluid\nproduced by the liver and is made up of several substances, including\ncholesterol, bilirubin, and bile salts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gallstones are pieces\nof solid material that form in the gallbladder. These stones develop because\ncholesterol and pigments in bile sometimes form hard particles when toxic\nchemicals enter your body..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The two main types of\ngallstones are:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cholesterol stones:\nUsually yellow-green in color, approximately 80% of gallstones are cholesterol\nstones.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pigment stones: These\nstones are smaller and darker and are made up of bilirubin.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Several factors may\ncome together to create gallstones, including, body weight, decreased motility\n(movement) of the gallbladder, poor processed food diet<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gallstones can form\nwhen there is an imbalance in the substances that make up bile. For instance,\ncholesterol stones may develop as a result of too much cholesterol in the bile.\nAnother cause may be the inability of the gallbladder to empty properly.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pigment stones are more\ncommon in people with certain medical conditions, such as cirrhosis (a liver\ndisease in which scar tissue replaces healthy liver tissue) . Obesity is one of\nthe biggest risk factors. Obesity can cause a rise in cholesterol and can also\nkeep the gallbladder from emptying completely.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gallstones are more\ncommon among women and older people.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some\ncholesterol-lowering drugs increase the amount of cholesterol in bile, which\nmay increase the chances of developing cholesterol stones.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People with diabetes\ntend to have higher levels of triglycerides (a type of blood fat), which is a\nrisk factor for gallstones.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gallstones range in\nsize from as small as a grain of sand to as large as a golf ball. Some people\ndevelop just one gallstone, while others develop many gallstones at the same\ntime.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People who experience\nsymptoms from their gallstones usually require gallbladder removal surgery.\nGallstones that don't cause any signs and symptoms typically don't need\ntreatment. Gallstones may cause no signs or symptoms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If a gallstone lodges\nin a duct and causes a blockage, signs and symptoms may result, such as:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sudden and rapidly\nintensifying pain in the upper right portion of your abdomen<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sudden and rapidly\nintensifying pain in the center of your abdomen, just below your breastbone<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Back pain between your\nshoulder blades<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pain in your right\nshoulder<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gallstone pain may last\nseveral minutes to a few hours.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Serious gallstone\ncomplication, such as:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Abdominal pain so\nintense that you can't sit still or find a comfortable position<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yellowing of your skin\nand the whites of your eyes<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">High fever with chills\nIt's not clear what causes gallstones to form. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Factors that may\nincrease your risk of gallstones include:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Being overweight or\nobese<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Eating a high-fat diet<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Eating a\nhigh-cholesterol diet<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Eating a low-fiber diet<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Having diabetes<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Losing weight very\nquickly<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Taking some\ncholesterol-lowering medications<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Complications of\ngallstones may include:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Inflammation of the\ngallbladder. A gallstone that becomes lodged in the neck of the gallbladder can\ncause inflammation of the gallbladder (cholecystitis). Cholecystitis can cause\nsevere pain and fever.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Blockage of the common\nbile duct. Gallstones can block the tubes (ducts) through which bile flows from\nyour gallbladder or liver to your small intestine. Jaundice and bile duct\ninfection can result.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Blockage of the\npancreatic duct. The pancreatic duct is a tube that runs from the pancreas to\nthe common bile duct. Pancreatic juices, which aid in digestion, flow through\nthe pancreatic duct. A gallstone can cause a blockage in the pancreatic duct,\nwhich can lead to inflammation of the pancreas (pancreatitis). Pancreatitis\ncauses intense, constant abdominal pain and usually requires hospitalization.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For signs of gallstones\n- an abdominal ultrasound and a computerized tomography (CT) scan to create\npictures of your gallbladder..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Magnetic resonance\nimaging (MRI) or endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP).\nGallstones discovered using ERCP can be removed during the procedure.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Blood tests to look for\ncomplications. Blood tests may reveal an infection, jaundice, pancreatitis or\nother complications caused by gallstones. Gallstones that don't cause signs and\nsymptoms, such as those detected during an ultrasound or CT scan done for some\nother condition, typically don't require treatment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Surgery to remove the\ngallbladder (cholecystectomy). Your doctor may recommend surgery to remove your\ngallbladder, if gallstones frequently recur. Once your gallbladder is removed,\nbile flows directly from your liver into your small intestine, rather than\nbeing stored in your gallbladder. You don't need your gallbladder to live, and\ngallbladder removal doesn't affect your ability to digest food, but it can\ncause diarrhea, which is usually temporary.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Medications you take by\nmouth may help dissolve gallstones. But it may take months or years of\ntreatment to dissolve your gallstones in this way.. You can reduce your risk of\ngallstones if you:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Don't skip meals. Try\nto stick to your usual mealtimes each day. Skipping meals or fasting can\nincrease the risk of gallstones.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lose weight slowly. If\nyou need to lose weight, go slow. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Liver disease is\nusually only painful if it stretches the capsule of the liver. Fatty liver\nusually occurs when your drink too much or drink too many beverages with HFCS\nsyrup like Coke. Pepsi etc . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An overgrowth of\nbacteria in the small intestine and other changes in the intestine may be\nassociated with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease if you are NOT too fat. Avoid\nmilk and milk products.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Become a vegetarian and\nstop drinking alcohol ( if you do so ) till your problem subsides. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Avoid too much of sugar\nand fat. Have isabgol fibre before you go to sleep. Take long walks. Eat\npeanuts and spinach.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bile helps to digest\nfood, particularly fatty foods. Gallstones occur when bile, which is normally\nfluid, forms stones. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A HEPATOLOGIST is the\nmost experienced and qualified type of doctor to treat people with liver\ndisease. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Curcumin ( turmeric )\nhelps bile secretion and storage by stimulating the bile duct and the\ngallbladder. Hat is why we Indians rarely got gall stones .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The gallbladder stores\nand helps secrete bile, which is a secretion made by the liver to digest fatty\nfoods. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the gallbladder is\nremoved, your liver will make enough bile for normal food, but spicy and greasy\nfoods will be difficult to digest.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c4578055823722144254\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The monosodium\nglutamate (MSG-Ajinomoto ) in instant noodles is reason enough to avoid them. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MSG is an excitotoxin,\nwhich means it overexcites your nerve cells to the point of damage or death,\ncausing brain dysfunction and damage to varying degrees \u2014 and potentially even\ntriggering or worsening learning disabilities, Alzheimer\u2019s disease, Parkinson\u2019s\ndisease, Lou Gehrig\u2019s disease, and more.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Part of the problem is\nthat free glutamic acid (MSG is moe than 80% free glutamic acid) is the same\nneurotransmitter that your brain, nervous system, eyes, pancreas, and other\norgans use to initiate certain processes in your body. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MSG is used to fatten\nup mice for scientific study. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Yes, MSG\nis the perfect obesity drug.&nbsp; You see\nthese Maggi eating children ,\u201dnot so bright\u201d and obese like halwais.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The reason why children\nlove to eat Maggi Noodles is due to MSG flavor and high sodium content.&nbsp; MSG is a flavour&nbsp; enhancer used by instant noodle makers to\nmake their shrimp flavours \u201dshrimpier\u201d.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Excessive eating of Instant noodles &nbsp;causes children to get very poor grades in\nschool.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Diets that are high in sugar and fat can suppress the activity of a\nbrain peptide called BDNF (brain-derived neurotrophic factor) that helps with\nlearning and memory formation.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fast foods are specially designed to be\naddictive in nature with high levels of salts, sugars and fats that make you\ncrave them. The addictive nature of fast food can make your brain crave them\neven when you are not hungry.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Excess consumption of trans fats found in fried\nand processed foods can send mixed signals to the brain which makes it\ndifficult to process what you have eaten and how hungry are.&nbsp;&nbsp; Trans fats may cause inflammation in\nhypothalamus, the part of brain that containing neurons to control body weight.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Monosodium glutamate, also known as sodium glutamate or MSG, is the sodium salt\nof glutamic acid, one of the most abundant naturally occurring non-essential\namino acid. The MSG we find on store shelves is processed and comes from\nfermented sugar beets. Because this kind of MSG is processed, it can cause many\nadverse reactions, including skin rashes, itching, hives, nausea, vomiting,\nmigraine headaches, asthma, heart irregularities, depression and even seizures.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since MSG acquired its infamous reputation for causing migraines, the food\nindustry has given it new names and new forms, including autolyzed yeast, yeast\nextract, maltodextrin, hydrolyzed protein, sodium caseinate, mono-potassium\nglutamate, and textured protein.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Certified doctors don\u2019t dare to do that\nas they could lose their professional certificate. Such is the clout of EVIL\nPHARMA and the powers of the medical profession in the pay roll of evil pharma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Due to processed foods\n, toxic soft drinks and dormant life styles , most people need to take\ncholesterol lowering drugs .&nbsp; Some\ncholesterol-lowering drugs increase the amount of cholesterol in bile, which\nmay increase the chances of developing cholesterol stones. There is no\nrelationship between cholesterol in the blood and cholesterol gallstones.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bile\nusually dissolves or breaks down cholesterol. But if your liver makes more\ncholesterol than your bile can dissolve, hard stones may develop.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bile acids that enter\nthe small intestine from the liver and gallbladder are absorbed back into the\nbody in the terminal ileum and are secreted again by the liver into bile. In\nother words, the bile acids recycle.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Crohn's disease ( JEW MONOPOLISED\nDISEASE ) , the terminal ileum is diseased. Bile acids are not absorbed\nnormally, the body becomes depleted of bile acids, and less bile acids are\nsecreted in bile. As a result there are not enough bile acids to keep\ncholesterol dissolved in bile, resulting in gallstone formation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are modern\nantibiotics ( example:&nbsp; Ceftriaxone / Rocephin).\nWhich are eliminated from the body in bile in high concentrations.&nbsp; &nbsp;It\ncombines with calcium in bile and becomes insoluble. &nbsp;Like cholesterol and pigment, the insoluble\nceftriaxone and calcium form particles that grow into gallstones.&nbsp; Evil Pharma will NOT tell you these things- it\nis all about making money, NOT service to mankind.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-4YPMX6wyRuk/VXjaB_7pJ6I/AAAAAAAA6r8/ade8Bj4Z9W8/s1600/img003tt0.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"428\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-4YPMX6wyRuk/VXjaB_7pJ6I/AAAAAAAA6r8/ade8Bj4Z9W8/s640/img003tt0.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Calcium carbonate can\nform gallstones.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The body can react to\nthe gallstone irritation by causing the gallbladder walls to become swollen and\npainful.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The episodes of\ninflammation can last for several hours, or even a few days. Fever is not\nunusual.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">About 20 percent of the\ntime, the sluggish, inflamed gallbladder is invaded by intestinal bacteria, and\nbecomes infected.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But most gallbladder\nsymptoms start with pain in the upper abdominal area, either in the upper right\nor middle.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bile is a watery liquid\nmade by the cells of the liver that is important for digesting food in the\nintestine, particularly fat.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Liver cells secrete the\nbile into small canals within the liver.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bile flows through\nthe canals and into larger collecting ducts within the liver (the intrahepatic\nbile ducts).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bile then flows\nthrough the intrahepatic bile ducts out of the liver and into the extrahepatic\nbile ducts-first into the hepatic bile ducts, then into the common hepatic\nduct, and finally into the common bile duct.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From the common bile\nduct, there are two different directions that bile can flow.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first direction is\nthrough the common bile duct and directly into the intestine where the bile\nmixes with food and promotes digestion of food.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The second direction is\ninto a off-shoot of the common bile duct, the cystic duct, and from there into\nthe gallbladder. Once in the gallbladder, bile is concentrated by the removal\n(absorption) of water.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During a meal, the muscle that makes up the wall of the\ngallbladder contracts and squeezes the concentrated bile in the gallbladder\nback through the cystic duct into the common bile duct and then into the intestine.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The timing of gallbladder contraction - during a meal - allows the concentrated\nbile from the gallbladder to mix with food. The gallbladder is able to release\nbile into the digestive system when it is needed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;
