The sailor was OK till he got off\nthe ship after 4 months.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is how reputations\nare earned at sea-- it takes 3 or 4 decades to build a reputation - BUT-- you\nare only as good as your last innings ( unlike Tendulkar ) . Reputations crash\nin just 3 seconds. One first foot failure or one grounding or one sailor's\ndeath --everything carefully built over decades , comes crashing down.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Imagine if this same\nman was in any place in Kerala, say at 5 PM. His wife makes a call to any\ndoctor, begging him to come fast or alteast give some advise on phone -- what\ndo you think will be the net result-- we all know it.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now even if his wife\ntakes him to the hospital , what do you think the learned doctor will do?&nbsp; Be frank, doctors!<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-PsSyZE9t3RM/VXorxohFzAI/AAAAAAAA6uU/S-Hi2guCl6Q/s1600/orig-21467h474.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"520\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-PsSyZE9t3RM/VXorxohFzAI/AAAAAAAA6uU/S-Hi2guCl6Q/s640/orig-21467h474.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">MOST PROCESSED FOODS CAUSE\nKIDNEY STONES .&nbsp; </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2015/06/kidney-and-gallbladder-stones-capt-ajit.html?showComment=1434190858257#c8973249479987035628\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">June 13, 2015 at 3:50 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_260MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi bz,<br />\n<br />\nmost people imagine the sexual innuendo -- a young girl creaming between her legs while dancing - on being watched by a male with obscene muscles.<br />\n<br />\nevery artist needs an appreciative audience.<br />\n<br />\nShiva resides in the highest Sahasr\u0101ra Chakra and Shakti in the lowest M\u016bl\u0101dh\u0101ra Chakra.<br />\n<br />\nSankhya philosophy unified the Advaita and Dvaita forms of Hinduism in a most interesting manner.<br />\n<br />\nWhen the insentient Prakriti ( female \u2013Dvaita ) comes in contact with the sentient Purusha (male \u2013Advaita ) , the universe evolves.<br />\n<br />\nPrakriti functions by borrowing consciousness from Purusha.<br />\n<br />\nPurusha is bewitched nay entranced by Prakriti . Prakriti is only too eager to oblige by displaying her subtle charms.<br />\n<br />\nPurusha, or supreme consciousness ( BrahmAn ) , is the impassive observer of all phenomena. Prakriti, excited in response to Purusa\u2019s attention , has her gunas ( Yin-Yang or Tamas \u2013Rajas ) thrown out of equilibrium.<br />\n<br />\nShe moves from transcendence to immanence and undergoes a series of transformations through which the multiform world comes into being. Purusha, was never really in bondage, or enmeshed with Prakriti.<br />\n<br />\nwell well-- what do these single messiah , single holy book ( like a multinational company manual ) religions know?<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</span></li>\n<span id=\"bc_0_259b+seedEDD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_259b+seedEDD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_259b+seedEDD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_259b+seedEDD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /><br />#############################</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kidney stones are hard\ncrystals formed in the kidneys.&nbsp;&nbsp; The\nstones usually produce no symptoms until they pass through the ureter, the\nmuscular tube that connects the kidneys and the bladder. When stones pass, they\ncan produce severe pain, nausea, vomiting and other symptoms.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nephrolithiasis is the\nmedical term for kidney stones. . Kidney stones are called renal calculi. Having\nstones at any location in the urinary tract is referred to as urolithiasis, and\nthe term ureterolithiasis is used to refer to stones located in the ureters.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Symptoms of a kidney\nstone include flank pain (the pain can be quite severe) and blood in the urine\n(hematuria).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dehydration is a major\nrisk factor for kidney stone formation. People with certain medical conditions,\nsuch as gout, and those who take certain medications or supplements are at risk\nfor kidney stones.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Diet is related to\nstone formation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your urine may lack\nsubstances that prevent crystals from sticking together, creating an ideal\nenvironment for kidney stones to form.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most kidney stones\neventually pass through the urinary tract on their own within 48 hours, with\nample fluid intake.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Four major types of\nkidney stones can form:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Calcium stones are the\nmost common type of kidney stone and occur in two major forms: calcium oxalate\nand calcium phosphate. Calcium oxalate stones are more common. Calcium oxalate\nstone formation may be caused by high calcium and high oxalate excretion. Calcium\nphosphate stones are caused by the combination of high urine calcium and\nalkaline urine, meaning the urine has a high pH. To help prevent calcium stones\nfrom forming, your doctor may prescribe a diuretic or a phosphate-containing\npreparation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Oxalate</b> is a naturally\noccurring substance found in food. Some fruits and vegetables, as well as nuts\nand chocolate, have high oxalate levels. Your liver also produces oxalate.\nDietary factors, high doses of vitamin D, and several metabolic disorders can\nincrease the concentration of calcium or oxalate in urine..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Uric acid</b> stones form\nwhen the urine is persistently acidic. A diet rich in purines\u2014substances found\nin animal protein such as meats, fish, and shellfish\u2014may increase uric acid in\nurine. If uric acid becomes concentrated in the urine, it can settle and form a\nstone by itself or along with calcium.&nbsp; Uric\nacid stones can form in people who don't drink enough fluids or who lose too\nmuch fluid, those who eat a high-protein diet, and those who have gout. Your\ndoctor may prescribe medicines to reduce uric acid levels in your blood and\nurine and a medicine to keep your urine alkaline.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Struvite </b>stones result\nfrom kidney infections. Eliminating infected stones from the urinary tract and\nstaying infection-free can prevent more struvite stones. These stones can grow\nquickly and become quite large, sometimes with few symptoms or little warning. To\nprevent struvite stones, your doctor may recommend strategies to keep your\nurine free of bacteria that cause infection<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Cystine</b> stones result\nfrom a genetic disorder that causes cystine ( amino acid ) to leak through the\nkidneys and into the urine, forming crystals that tend to accumulate into\nstones. . Your doctor may also prescribe a medication that decreases the amount\nof cystine in your urine.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first step in\npreventing kidney stones is to understand what is causing the stones to form.\ne, limiting oxalate in the diet may help prevent calcium oxalate stones but\nwill do nothing to prevent uric acid stones. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some dietary\nrecommendations may apply to more than one type of stone. Most notably,\ndrinking enough fluids helps prevent all kinds of kidney stones by keeping\nurine diluted and flushing away materials that might form stones.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If a person can catch a\nkidney stone as it passes, in a tea strainer , &nbsp;it can be sent to a lab for analysis. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even children as young\nas 5 years are getting kidney stones today\u2014something unimaginable before soft\ndrinks like Coke with HFCS ( high fructose corn syrup ) and high Sodium salt processed\nfoods were invented.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The APCO branded\nIndian govt gets political donations from these Zionist soft drink\nmultinationals - and hence turns a Nelson\u2019s eye.&nbsp;&nbsp; It is all about grabbing power and remaining\nin power by hook or by crook.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Too much sodium\nconsumption causes more calcium to be excreted into the urine, precipitating\nkidney stones made of calcium and phosphorus. Sodium&nbsp; decreases urinary output by causing more\nwater to be reabsorbed by the kidneys, further increasing the risk of stones.\nProcessed foods, canned soups, hot dogs and cured meats are generally high in\nsodium and should be avoided by people with calcium phosphate stones.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Salt is\nnot the only source of sodium. Monosodium glutamate (MSG), baking soda and\nbaking powder, and the common preservative sodium nitrate all have sodium as\nthe main ingredient. Avoid these ingredients<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GM Soybeans and\nsoy-based foods promote kidney stones in those prone to them, as they may\ncontain high levels of oxalates, which can bind with calcium in your kidney to\nform kidney stones.&nbsp; This is just one\nreason why unfermented soy -- the type found in soy milk, soy burgers, soy ice\ncream, and even tofu -- is not a health food. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Blood and urine can\nalso be tested for unusual levels of chemicals such as calcium, oxalate, and\nsodium to help determine what type of kidney stone a person may have had.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People can help prevent\nkidney stones by making changes in fluid intake and, depending on the type of\nkidney stone, changes in consumption of sodium, animal protein, calcium, and\noxalate.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Drinking enough fluids\neach day is the best way to help prevent most types of kidney stones. a person\ndrink 2 to 3 liters of fluid a day. People with cystine stones may need to\ndrink even more. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Recommendations based\non the specific type of kidney stone include the following:----<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Calcium Oxalate Stones--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">reducing sodium<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">reducing animal\nprotein, such as meat, eggs, and fish<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">getting enough calcium\nfrom food or taking calcium supplements with food<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">avoiding foods high in\noxalate, such as spinach, rhubarb, nuts, and wheat bran<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Calcium Phosphate\nStones--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">reducing sodium<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">reducing animal protein<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">getting enough calcium\nfrom food or taking calcium supplements with food<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Uric Acid Stones--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">limiting animal protein<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People who have had a\nkidney stone should drink enough water and other fluids to produce at least 2\nliters of urine a day. People who have had cystine stones may need to drink\neven more.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The amount of fluid each person needs to drink depends on the weather\nand the person\u2019s activity level\u2014people who work or exercise in hot weather need\nmore fluid to replace the fluid they lose through sweaty.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the volume of\nurine produced is too low, the person can be advised to increase fluid intake.\nDrinking enough fluid is the most important thing a person can do to prevent\nkidney stones.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">citrus drinks like\nlemonade and orange juice protect against kidney stones because they contain\ncitrate, which stops crystals from growing into stones.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sodium, often from\nsalt, causes the kidneys to excrete more calcium into the urine. High\nconcentrations of calcium in the urine combine with oxalate and phosphorus to\nform stones. Reducing sodium intake is preferred to reducing calcium intake.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The risk of kidney\nstones increases with increased daily sodium consumption. People who form\ncalcium oxalate or calcium phosphate stones should limit their intake.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meats and other animal\nprotein\u2014such as eggs and fish\u2014contain purines, which break down into uric acid\nin the urine. Foods especially rich in purines include organ meats, such as\nliver. People who form uric acid stones should limit their meat consumption <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Animal protein may also\nraise the risk of calcium stones by increasing the excretion of calcium and\nreducing the excretion of citrate into the urine. Citrate prevents kidney\nstones, but the acid in animal protein reduces the citrate in urine.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Calcium from food does\nnot increase the risk of calcium oxalate stones. Calcium in the digestive tract\nbinds to oxalate from food and keeps it from entering the blood, and then the\nurinary tract, where it can form stones.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People who form calcium oxalate stones\nshould include 800 mg of calcium in their diet every day, not only for kidney\nstone prevention but also to maintain bone density Other dairy products such as\nyogurt are also high in calcium. Calcium supplements may increase the risk of\ncalcium oxalate stones if they are not taken with food.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Eating certain foods\nwith high levels of oxalate can increase the amount of oxalate in the urine,\nwhere it combines with calcium to form calcium oxalate stones. Foods that have\nbeen shown to increase the amount of oxalate in urine include---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">spinach <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">nuts<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">wheat bran<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">peanuts<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">beets<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">sweet potato<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">chocolate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Avoiding these foods\nmay help reduce the amount of oxalate in the urine.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Diets that are low in\ncarbohydrates increase the risk of uric acid stones .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sodium, often from\nsalt, causes the kidneys to excrete more calcium into the urine. High\nconcentrations of calcium in the urine combine with oxalate and phosphorus to\nform stones. Reducing sodium intake is preferred to reducing calcium intake.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meats and other animal\nprotein\u2014such as eggs and fish\u2014contain purines, which break down into uric acid\nin the urine.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Calcium from food does\nnot increase the risk of calcium oxalate stones. Calcium in the digestive tract\nbinds to oxalate from food and keeps it from entering the blood, and then the\nurinary tract, where it can form stones.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Citrus fruits such as\noranges and lemons have citrate, an alkaline substance that raises the pH of\nurine. As the urine pH rises, so does the risk of calcium phosphate stones.\nAvoid oranges, lemons, tangerines and the juices made from these fruits.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some diet sodas contain\nhigher amounts of citrate than homemade lemon juice. Consuming these beverages\nmay increase the risk of kidney stones. People with calcium phosphate stones\nshould not drink these beverages.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Animal proteins\nincrease urinary calcium excretion as more calcium is taken from the bones to\nneutralize the acidity of these proteins. People with calcium phosphate stones\nshould avoid eating too much meat, fish and poultry.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Urinary tract stones\nare more common in men than in women. Most urinary stones develop in people\n20-49 years of age, and those who are prone to multiple attacks of kidney\nstones usually develop their first stones during the second or third decade of\nlife. People who have already had more than one kidney stone are prone to\ndeveloping further stones.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pregnancy-related\nchanges may increase the risk of stone formation. Factors that may contribute\nto stone formation during pregnancy include a slowing of the passage of urine\ndue to increased progesterone levels and diminished fluid intake due to a\ndecreasing bladder capacity from the enlarging uterus. Healthy pregnant women\nalso have a mild increase in their urinary calcium excretion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some medications also\nraise the risk of kidney stones. These medications include some diuretics,\ncalcium-containing antacids.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are several\nfactors which influence the ability to pass a stone. These include the size of\nthe person, prior stone passage, prostate enlargement, pregnancy, and the size\nof the stone. A 4 mm stone has an 80% chance of passage while a 5 mm stone has\na 20% chance. Stones larger than 9 mm-10 mm rarely pass without specific\ntreatment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some medications have\nbeen used to increase the passage rates of kidney stones. These include calcium\nchannel blockers and alpha blockers. These drugs may be prescribed to some\npeople who have stones that do not rapidly pass through the urinary tract.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-2EtzDwLsu24/VXx7SUWceoI/AAAAAAAA6vg/mUJwJL27uyE/s1600/imgrfges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"303\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-2EtzDwLsu24/VXx7SUWceoI/AAAAAAAA6vg/mUJwJL27uyE/s400/imgrfges.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Strong painkillers are\noften needed to ease the pain until you pass the stone.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For kidney stones that\ndo not pass on their own, a procedure called lithotripsy is often used. In this\nprocedure, shock waves are used to break up a large stone into smaller pieces\nthat can then pass through the urinary system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Surgical techniques\nhave also been developed to remove kidney stones when other treatment methods\nare not effective. This may be done through a small incision in the skin\n(percutaneous nephrolithotomy) or through an instrument known as an\nureteroscope passed through the urethra and bladder up into the ureter.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ureteroscopy is a procedure where &nbsp;a thin telescope is passed up into the ureter\nvia the urethra and bladder. Once the stone is seen, a laser (or other form of\nenergy) is used to break up the stone. This technique is suitable for most\ntypes of stone<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A nephroscope (a thin\ntelescope-like instrument) is passed through the skin and into the kidney. The\nstone is broken up and the fragments of stone are removed via the nephroscope.\nThis procedure is usually done under general anaesthetic.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stone removal can be\ndone by a traditional operation where the skin has to be cut to allow access to\nthe ureter and kidney. This is only needed in a very small number of cases\nwhere the above, newer techniques have not worked or are not possible. It may\nbe done if you have a very large stone in your kidney.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Rather than having to undergo treatment, it is\nbest to avoid kidney stones in the first place when possible. It can be\nespecially helpful to drink more water, since low fluid intake and dehydration\nare major risk factors for kidney stone formation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Drinking lemon juice may\nbe helpful in preventing kidney stones.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People who have had a\nkidney stone remain at risk for future stones throughout their lives.. Many\nwaste chemicals are dissolved in the urine\u2014never drink your own urine .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-gVXxW1_kvVs/VXx7LneeWvI/AAAAAAAA6vY/zVzsfRaKLz0/s1600/imat67ges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-gVXxW1_kvVs/VXx7LneeWvI/AAAAAAAA6vY/zVzsfRaKLz0/s1600/imat67ges.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Signs and symptoms:----<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Severe pain in the side\nand back, below the ribs<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Pain that spreads to\nthe lower abdomen and groin<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Pain that comes in\nwaves and fluctuates in intensity<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Pain on urination<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Pink, red or brown\nurine<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Cloudy or foul-smelling\nurine<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Nausea and vomiting<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Persistent need to\nurinate<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Urinating more often\nthan usual<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Fever and chills if an\ninfection is present<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Urinating small amounts\nof urine</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pain caused by a kidney\nstone may change \u2014 for instance, shifting to a different location or increasing\nin intensity \u2014 as the stone moves through your urinary tract.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-9ejnG5LDRG0/VXx7C8CNqZI/AAAAAAAA6vQ/LppTC4JL7Ms/s1600/image8mbs.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-9ejnG5LDRG0/VXx7C8CNqZI/AAAAAAAA6vQ/LppTC4JL7Ms/s400/image8mbs.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Seek immediate medical\nattention if you experience:----<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pain so severe that you\ncan't sit still or find a comfortable position<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pain accompanied by\nnausea and vomiting<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pain accompanied by\nfever and chills<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Blood in your urine<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If your doctor suspects\nyou have a kidney stone, you may have diagnostic tests and procedures, such as:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Blood testing. Blood\ntests may reveal too much calcium or uric acid in your blood. Blood test\nresults help monitor the health of your kidneys and may lead your doctor to\ncheck for other medical conditions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Urine testing. The\n24-hour urine collection test may show that you're excreting too many\nstone-forming minerals or too few stone-preventing substances. For this test,\nyour doctor may request that you perform two urine collections over two\nconsecutive days.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Imaging. Imaging tests\nmay show kidney stones in your urinary tract. Options range from simple\nabdominal X-rays, which can miss small kidney stones, to high-speed or dual\nenergy computerized tomography (CT) that may reveal even tiny stones.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Other imaging options\ninclude an ultrasound, a noninvasive test, and intravenous urography, which\ninvolves injecting dye into an arm vein and taking X-rays (intravenous\npyelogram) or obtaining CT images (CT urogram) as the dye travels through your\nkidneys and bladder.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Some calcium phosphate stones are caused by\noveractive parathyroid glands, which are located on the four corners of your\nthyroid gland, just below your Adam's apple. When these glands produce too much\nparathyroid hormone (hyperparathyroidism), your calcium levels can become too\nhigh and kidney stones may form as a result.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hyperparathyroidism\nsometimes occurs when a small, benign tumor forms in one of your parathyroid\nglands or you develop another condition that leads these glands to produce more\nparathyroid hormone. Removing the growth from the gland stops the formation of\nkidney stones. Or your doctor may recommend treatment of the condition that's\ncausing your parathyroid gland to overproduce the hormone.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your doctor may ask that you measure your\nurine output to make sure that you're drinking enough water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ayurveda uses pomegranate\nseeds and some herbs for kidney health<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/09/pomegranate-divine-fruit-capt-ajit.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/09/pomegranate-divine-fruit-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/aj-gbnOB4jM/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/aj-gbnOB4jM?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the pain radiates\nfrom the loin to the groin region it means that the stone is migrating down\nfrom the kidney towards the bladder.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Increase intake of\nmagnesium and citrate. Magnesium can lower the risk of stone formation. If you\nsuffer from kidney stones, ensure that your magnesium intake is adequate.\nRefined processed foods removes all magnesium from the foods.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Avoid drinking A1 toxic\nmilk of humpless cows.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With the govt turning a\nblind eye to Zionist soft drinks and processed foods ,it is estimated that one\nin eight people will have a kidney stone at some time in their lives.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nephrologists and EVIL Pharma are laughing all the way to the bank.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-fIJu8zIfi3g/VX55x4uf7BI/AAAAAAAA6x8/j2r10XZb_lw/s1600/atkinws-advantage-ingredients.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Processed foods are infused\nwith preservatives, artificial colors, and artificial flavorings. Generally if\nyou see canned processed foods with extra long shelf life, you must know it is\ninfused with toxic preservatives.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The best way to avoid\ntoxic chemical additives is to consume only fresh whole organic foods. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Consuming artificial\nsweeteners has been shown to result in even greater weight gain than consuming\nsugar. We have stars like Bipasha Basu pushing artificial sweeteners like Sugar\nFree Gold.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; This oxidized cholesterol (not dietary cholesterol in and of\nitself) causes increased thromboxane formation\u2014a factor that clots your blood.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even when not oxidized\nby frying, soybean and corn oils can oxidize inside the body.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You need Saturated Fats\nlike Virgin coconut oil and humped cow ghee for healthy brain function<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ErOyiI68r_A/VYFlFfOuEtI/AAAAAAAA66I/u_Wp-timz4c/s1600/joshblurFb.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"316\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ErOyiI68r_A/VYFlFfOuEtI/AAAAAAAA66I/u_Wp-timz4c/s640/joshblurFb.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the last decade,\nwe've also shifted over to genetically engineered (GE) grains and sugar (GE\nsugar beets and corn), all of which harm our health.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Besides the damage from\ntrans fats, vegetable oils such as peanut, corn, and soy oil degrade into\nhighly toxic oxidation products called cyclic aldehydes when heated, and these\nbyproducts may actually do more harm than trans fat. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Acrylamide is a highly\ntoxic byproduct produced when starchy or carbohydrate-rich foods such as\npotatoes and grains are fried or cooked at high temperatures.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">French fries, chips, cookies, crackers, and\ncereals tend to have some of the highest levels of acrylamide, courtesy of the\nprocessing they've been put through. &nbsp;&nbsp;Acrylamide\nis a known neurotoxin, and animal research has revealed clear evidence of\ncarcinogenic activity.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-48RT04Ipp6Y/VYFkNV6iqKI/AAAAAAAA66A/CN69VEK45RQ/s1600/Drugs-vs-CoconuYt-Oil.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Preservatives lengthen\nthe shelf life of foods, increasing manufacturers\u2019 profits\u2014 at your expense,\nsince most are linked to health problems such as cancer, allergic reactions, kidney/\ngall bladder stones and more. Always check the expiry dates of processed foods.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Food manufacturers add\npreservatives to processed foods to keep them from going bad. Butylated\nhydroxyanisole (BHA) and butylated hydroxytoluene (BHT) are two preservatives\nused to keep fats from going rancid. BHA and BHT (butylated hydroxyanisole and\nbutylated hydrozyttoluene)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Chewing\ngum, breakfast cereals, breads, crackers, potato chips, nut mixes, and many\nothers&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Neurological problems,\nbehavioral issues, hormonal issues, metabolic dysfunction, and cancer.&nbsp; BHT increase levels of liver enzymes<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-rxIymyrEhQQ/VX7CQwrWdPI/AAAAAAAA6yo/9rWfcF60qqc/s1600/the-goohd-the-bad-and-the-ugly-pp-10-728.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-rxIymyrEhQQ/VX7CQwrWdPI/AAAAAAAA6yo/9rWfcF60qqc/s640/the-goohd-the-bad-and-the-ugly-pp-10-728.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/q5t78kAsbeE/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/q5t78kAsbeE?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TBHQ (tertiary-butyl\nhydroquinone) TBHQ is a synthetic\nantioxidant that is used to extend the shelf life of oily and fatty foods. In\nprocessed foods, it's sprayed on the food or on its packaging to prevent\ndiscoloration and changes to flavor and odor. It is used in Instant noodles,\ncrackers, candy, commercial pizza, and many others.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; padding: 16px 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_286b+seedEkD\" kind=\"d\"><img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-DUOJiRC5obw/UwiDtflONuI/AAAAAAAAppU/hpxnNJK2CIw/s1600/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_286b+seedEkD\" kind=\"d\">\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3543309980538320461\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_293M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2015/06/kidney-and-gallbladder-stones-capt-ajit.html?showComment=1434417104927#c3543309980538320461\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">June 16, 2015 at 6:41 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_293MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi a,<br />\n<br />\nTHERE IS NO CURE FOR PROGRESSIVE SUPRANUCLEAR PALSY. The disease usually develops after the sixth decade of life.<br />\n<br />\nNo lab test can confirm the diagnosis of PSP--- Blood tests may be done to rule out other conditions that cause dementia symptoms. These include infections, blood disorders, chemical abnormalities, hormonal disorders, and liver or kidney problems<br />\n<br />\nThe average life expectancy is around seven years from onset.<br />\n<br />\nIT COULD HAVE BEEN PREVENTED OR ABORTED BY MEDICAL MARIJUANA IN ITS EARLY STAGES.--NO DOCTOR WILL AGREE WITH ME HOWEVER.<br />\n<br />\nREMEMBER THIS BLOGSITE GIVES AN OUTSIDERs VIEW -ONLY INFORMATION-NEVER ADVISE.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/10/say-no-to-plastics-human-suffering-and.html<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nbefore the zionists meddles with the food chain-- this disease of PSP did NOT exist.<br />\n<br />\neven today a lot of western people who suffer from VARIANT CREUTZFELDT JACOB DISEASE are being deliberately misdiagnosed as parkinson's , dementia, alzhiemers, PSP etc- to save the politicians who FED MEAT TO VEGETARIAN COWS.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/12/shocking-legacy-of-mad-cow-disease-capt.html<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nPSP was called Steele-Richardson-Olszewski syndrome, after the 3 scientists who first described it in 1963--before PROCESSED FOOD was introduced this disease never existed.<br />\n<br />\nProgressive \u2013 it gets steadily worse over time<br />\nSupranuclear \u2013 it damages parts of the brain above the pea-sized \u2018nuclei\u2019 that control eye movements<br />\nPalsy \u2013 it causes weakness (of eye)<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n.PSP is progressive, meaning that it gets worse over time. The disease affects the part of the brain above the nuclei (\u201csupranuclear\u201d), which are pea-sized structures in the part of the nervous system that controls eye movements. Palsy means weakness, and it is this characteristic weakness in eye movements for which the disease is named.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_293MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/delete-comment.g?blogID=3564735312144269387&amp;postID=3543309980538320461\" o=\"d\" style=\"color: #888888; padding-right: 5px; padding-top: 5px; text-decoration: none;\" target=\"_self\">Delete</a></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_293BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_293B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</span></li>\n<span id=\"bc_0_286b+seedEkD\" kind=\"d\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_294B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-DUOJiRC5obw/UwiDtflONuI/AAAAAAAAppU/hpxnNJK2CIw/s1600/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c4825213858023035127\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_294M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2015/06/kidney-and-gallbladder-stones-capt-ajit.html?showComment=1434417152670#c4825213858023035127\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">June 16, 2015 at 6:42 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_294MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\n<br />\n#################################<br />\n<br />\nIMPORTANT :<br />\n<br />\nThe classic eye movement problem is an inability to voluntarily move the eyes downward, which occurs because of lesions in the area of the brain that coordinates eye movements. Ultimately, all voluntary eye movements may be lost.<br />\n<br />\nPeople with PSP usually stand straight or occasionally even tilt their heads backward (and tend to fall backward), while those with Parkinson's disease usually bend forward.<br />\n<br />\nLoss of REM sleep.<br />\n<br />\n#############################<br />\n<br />\nthere is eye focus problem, double or tunnel vision and dislike of bright lights.<br />\n<br />\nTo prevent falling backwards patients can use weighted walking aids.Bifocals or special glasses called prisms are sometimes prescribed to remedy the difficulty of looking down .<br />\n<br />\nGradually, the following more specific symptoms appear for people with PSP:<br />\n<br />\nUnexplained balance problems<br />\nStiff or awkward steps while walking<br />\nVery slow movements<br />\nFrequent falls, clumsiness<br />\nVisual problems - Blurry or double vision, problems controlling eye movements (inability to maintain eye contact), light sensitivity<br />\nBehavior or personality changes - Irritation, grouchiness<br />\nMemory loss, forgetfulness<br />\nApathy (indifference)<br />\nSlowed thinking, reasoning, planning<br />\nInappropriate laughing or crying<br />\nAngry or aggressive outbursts<br />\nSlurred speech<br />\nSwallowing problems - Solids and liquids<br />\nMask-like facial expression (no expression)<br />\nMuscle spasms<br />\nInability to hold urine (incontinence) - Late stages only<br />\n<br />\nDifficulty swallowing (dysphagia) is one of the common complications of PSP and can cause choking or inhaling food or liquid into the airways (aspiration). Aspiration can develop into pneumonia.<br />\n<br />\nA surgeon can place a feeding tube in the stomach in a simple procedure called a gastrostomy. This is necessary for people who cannot swallow enough food to maintain good nutrition.<br />\n<br />\nA loss of interest in ordinary pleasurable activities or increased irritability, cantankerousness, and forgetfulness. Individuals may suddenly laugh or cry for no apparent reason, they may be apathetic, or they may have occasional angry outbursts, also for no apparent reason.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nRemember- individuals affected by PSP have trouble voluntarily shifting their gaze downward, and also can have trouble controlling their eyelids. This can lead to involuntary closing of the eyes, prolonged or infrequent blinking, or difficulty in opening the eyes. there is an inability to maintain eye contact during a conversation.<br />\n<br />\nDaily physical exercise helps keep the body strong and flexible and stimulates the mind. The individual should engage in as much mental activity as he or she can handle. Puzzles, games, reading, and safe hobbies and crafts are good choices. Ideally, these activities should be interactive. They should be of an appropriate level of difficulty to ensure that the person does not become overly frustrated.<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_294MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/delete-comment.g?blogID=3564735312144269387&amp;postID=4825213858023035127\" o=\"d\" style=\"color: #888888;
